Class SubjectDatabase

  • java.lang.Object
    • SubjectDatabase
  • public class SubjectDatabase
extends java.lang.Object
    The SubjectDatabase class represent a list of Subject objects.
    Version:
    31 Oct 2021
    Author:
    Tze Loon Neoh

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      SubjectDatabase()
      Construct an empty list of subjects.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void addSubject​(Subject newSubject)
      Add a Subject object to a SubjectDatabase object to be processed.
      void clearSubjectDatabase()
      Empty a SubjectDatabase object to be processed.
      void displaySubjectDatabaseAsOptions()
      Print out all subjects in the SubjectDatabase object of all the subjects offered at the school.
      void displaySubjectDatabaseAsResults()
      Print out all subjects in a SubjectDatabase object to be processed.
      int getSize()
      Return the number of Subject objects in the SubjectDatabase object to be processed.
      Subject getSubject​(int index)
      Given an integer, return a Subject object at the (integer)th index in a SubjectDatabase object to be processed.
      SubjectDatabase matchSubjectsByIndexes​(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> subjectIndexes)
      Given an ArrayList of integers, iterate through the list and create a SubjectDatabase object to store the Subject object(s) at the (integer - 1)th index in the SubjectDatabase object of all the subjects offered at the school.
      void removeSubject​(Subject newSubject)
      Remove a Subject object from a SubjectDatabase object to be processed.

        Construct an empty list of subjects.

    • Method Detail

      • getSize

        public int getSize()
        Return the number of Subject objects in the SubjectDatabase object to be processed.
        Returns:
        The number of subjects recorded on the list.

      • getSubject

        public Subject getSubject​(int index)
        Given an integer, return a Subject object at the (integer)th index in a SubjectDatabase object to be processed.
        Returns:
        The subject at the given index on the list.

      • clearSubjectDatabase

        public void clearSubjectDatabase()
        Empty a SubjectDatabase object to be processed.

      • addSubject

        public void addSubject​(Subject newSubject)
        Add a Subject object to a SubjectDatabase object to be processed.
        Parameters:
        newSubject - The Subject object to be added.

      • removeSubject

        public void removeSubject​(Subject newSubject)
        Remove a Subject object from a SubjectDatabase object to be processed.
        Parameters:
        newSubject - The Subject object to be removed.

      • displaySubjectDatabaseAsOptions

        public void displaySubjectDatabaseAsOptions()
        Print out all subjects in the SubjectDatabase object of all the subjects offered at the school.

      • displaySubjectDatabaseAsResults

        public void displaySubjectDatabaseAsResults()
        Print out all subjects in a SubjectDatabase object to be processed.

      • matchSubjectsByIndexes

        public SubjectDatabase matchSubjectsByIndexes​(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> subjectIndexes)
        Given an ArrayList of integers, iterate through the list and create a SubjectDatabase object to store the Subject object(s) at the (integer - 1)th index in the SubjectDatabase object of all the subjects offered at the school.
        Parameters:
        subjectIndexes - The list of integer(s) to be processed.
        Returns:
        The list of selected subjects .
